Player History
Earned first career win on 5/2/2013...
Had first career hit on 6/7/2014, off Roy Halladay (SF)...
Won Player of the Week award on 6/19/2014, winning 2 games with a 0.00 ERA...
Was selected to the 2014 Allstar game...
Won Cy Young in 2014, going 19-6, 2.94 ERA...
1/30/2015: Gets a new one-year contract worth $2,700,000 through salary arbitration...
Won World Series with Kansas City in 2015...
1/30/2016: Gets a new one-year contract worth $2,700,000 through salary arbitration...
Injured on 4/28/2016 with a Tender Shoulder, out for one week...
1/30/2017: Gets a new one-year contract worth $2,700,000 through salary arbitration...
0/0/2018: Gets a new one-year contract worth $2,700,000 through salary arbitration...
Traded from Kansas City to St. Louis on 2/1/2018 (Going to STL: LF Eliezer Mesa, P Danny Duffy. Going to KC: 1B Matthew Adams)...
Injured on 5/29/2018 with a Strained Elbow Ligament, out for one week...
8/19/2018: Signed a contract extension with St. Louis, $15,000,000 per year, for 3 years.
Traded from St. Louis to Philadelphia on 7/31/2020 (Going to STL: CF Martin Campo, P Dominic Jacquez. Going to PHI: P Danny Duffy)...
Injured on 9/11/2021 with a Strained Tricep Muscle, out for 6 weeks...
Signed as a free agent by New York (A) on 2/4/2022 to a 2-year deal worth $22,000,000 per year...
Released by New York (A) on 10/28/2022...
10/28/2024: Signed a contract extension with Toronto, $1,170,000 per year, for 2 years.
